intro: Gardenia hutchinsoniana, commonly known as the Hutchinson's gardenia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces fragrant, white to yellowish flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. The flowers are typically borne on short, branched inflorescences and bloom during the summer months.
